LanguageData.GR_AgeDiseaseText: {0} has reached the limit of its stable lifespan, and has acquired a genetic disease: {1}\n\nGenetic diseases are incurable. They can be treated to delay the inevitable, but the animal will eventually perish.
LanguageData.GR_LackOfLove: Dying due to lack of love in: {0}
LanguageData.GR_CantResurrect: Animals that have been extracted can't be resurrected.
LanguageData.GR_NoValidExtraction: No valid genes can be extracted from this animal with this extractor
LanguageData.GR_AlreadyExtracted: This animal has already had its genetic material extracted
LanguageData.GR_ExcavatorUsesLeft: This genome excavator has {0} uses left
LanguageData.GR_ExtractionFailed: The animal can't be reached by the colonist, or is being interacted with by another colonist
LanguageData.GR_DesignateGrowthCellDesc: Select genomes, genoframe and optionally a booster to create a growthcell of a selected hybrid
LanguageData.GR_GenomorpherExplanation: Select genomes, genoframe and optionally a booster to create a growthcell of a selected hybrid
LanguageData.GR_GenomorpherExplanationPartTwo: Use immunity boosters or use safer genome combinations to lower the risk of failure.
LanguageData.GR_SelectDominantGenomeExplanation: Dominant genome affects primary characteristics of the hybrid
LanguageData.GR_SelectSecondaryGenomeExplanation: Affects the hybrid less than the dominant one
LanguageData.GR_SelectGenoframeExplanation: Genoframe affects the quality level of the hybrid
LanguageData.GR_SelectBoosterExplanation: Boosters affect the speed of the synthesis process as well as the failure chance
LanguageData.GR_InitiateSynthesisExplanation: Initiating synthesis will have your colonists deliver all the required ingredients to this Genomorpher. After synthesis concludes, a growthcell of a hybrid will have to be extracted and inserted into an electrowomb where it will grow to maturity. Larger animals may require large electrowomb.
LanguageData.GR_QualityExplanation: Use higher grade genoframes to increase the quality of the hybrid.
LanguageData.GR_ProcessDurationExplanation: Use growth boosters or construct additional nutrient vats to speed up the process.
LanguageData.GR_NoIngredientFound: No ingredients found to start the genomorpher process
LanguageData.GR_SelectAnimalToHarvestDesc: Select animal to harvest. This animal will be brought to the DNA bank and harvested for its DNA. It will kill the animal and destroy its body.
LanguageData.GR_NoValidAnimalsToExtract: No colony animals with that genome
LanguageData.GR_AreYouSureDNA: Are you sure you want to change the accepted genome? All current progress will be lost
LanguageData.GR_DuplicatedGenomeSelection: There is already a DNA storage bank nearby with that genome chosen
LanguageData.GR_BeginArchotechGrowthCellDesc: Begin creation of an archotech growth cell. This will need all neccessary DNA banks to be at 100% progress
LanguageData.GR_ArchotechGrowthCellNotInserted: An archotech growth cell needs to be inserted in the archowomb before the process can be started
LanguageData.GR_BeginArchotechCentipedeDesc: Create the Archotech centipede. The process will take about 15 days, and the energy signature will be detectable from a long distance away.
LanguageData.GR_BeginArchotechCentipedeText:
You are ready to start the archotech centipede project.

The process will take about 15 days, and the energy signature will be detectable from a long distance away. This sort of energy signature indicates that someone is meddling in technology that is far beyond human understanding, and will attract gangs of desperate raiders and swarms of deadly mechanoids.

You will be assaulted with an intensity you've never seen. Make sure your defenses are prepared first.
LanguageData.GR_GameOverArchotech:
You've activated the Archotech Project! These colonists were present for the archotech awakening:

{0}

The Archotech Centipede is now under their control, and you are free to decimate your enemies and control the planet unopposed.

Congratulations, you have won the game with the Vanilla Genetics Expanded mod!
LanguageData.GR_HybridRoleCombatDesc: Combat hybrids excel at either melee or ranged combat. These hybrids will benefit the most from implants and controller boosters.
LanguageData.GR_HybridRoleFarmDesc: Farm hybrids produce some sort of resource over time, but generally need to be kept inside an animal pen. These hybrids will not benefit as much from implants and controller boosters.
LanguageData.GR_HybridRoleUtilityDesc: Utility hybrids bring some kind of mechanic to the colony that isn't strictly used for combat or resource generation.
LanguageData.GR_CreatureMindControlDesc: Use mind control to order this creature around the map
LanguageData.GR_CreatureRageAttackDesc: Send the creature in a bloodthristy rage against its target
LanguageData.GR_DetonateChemfuelDesc: Remotely detonate the chemfuel reservoirs of this creature. The animal will be affected and damaged by the resulting explosion
LanguageData.GR_InflictChickenRimPoxDesc: Attacks a target and inflicts Chicken RimPox, a debilitating disease
LanguageData.GR_CarryMoreDesc: This hybrid is carrying more weight than usual due to the influence of the animal control hub
LanguageData.GR_StartAdrenalineBurstDesc: Causes the creature to move much faster for a while, at the cost of getting tired afterwards for almost half a day
LanguageData.GR_ReleaseInsectCloudsDesc: Causes the creature to release insect clouds around it, damaging every pawn that isn't an insect hybrid
LanguageData.GR_StartStampedeDesc: Stampedes, moving faster and creating dust clouds that block line of view for projectile weapons. Gets the creature tired after a while
LanguageData.GR_CreatePoisonousCloudDesc: Creates a cloud of poison at a target's location
LanguageData.GR_StartBurrowingDesc: Sends the creature underground into burrowing mode, making it very resistant to damage for a while
LanguageData.GR_StartStaminaDesc: Makes the creature more resistant to damage for a while
LanguageData.GR_StartInvokingInsanityDesc: Invokes the insanity of That Which Man Is Not Meant to Know
LanguageData.GR_StartMechaBlastDesc: Vents exhaust in the tiles surounding the mechanoid hybrid, burning anything close to it
LanguageData.GR_StartKeenSensesDesc: Makes the creature more aware of its surroundings, increasing its melee capacities (affects sight and consciousness)
LanguageData.GR_StartCatReflexesDesc: Makes the creature much more agile, improving its chance to dodge melee attacks even further
LanguageData.GR_OrbitalDesc: That's a nice... existance you have there. It would be a shame if someone were to end it.
LanguageData.GR_AbilityRecharging: Ability is rechaging. Check animal's health tab
LanguageData.GR_PoisonCloudRange: Poison cloud has a maximum range of 10. Get closer to the target!
LanguageData.GR_InvokingInsanityRange: Invoking insanity has a maximum range of 10. Get closer to the target!
LanguageData.GR_SafetyDesc: Safety is a number that gets deducted from the Failed outcome chance. For example, safety 5 reduces the risk of the failed outcome by 5% (from 10% to 5%). This value can also be negative, increasing the risk of a failed experiment.
LanguageData.GR_StabilityDesc: Stability is a number that gets deducted from the swap chance. For example, stability 5 means that the base chance of the genes swapping turns from 10% to 5% (becoming more stable). This value can also be negative, which will mean the chance of genomes swapping their positions and resulting in an unwanted hybrid are larger.
LanguageData.GR_TimeMultiplierDesc: Time multiplier accelerates or increases the time taken by the genomorpher to complete its task. A fractional modifier accelerates the process (for example 0.5 means it will take half the usual time), while a modifier larger than 1 slows it down (2 means it will take double the time).
LanguageData.GR_GenomorpherSpeedMultiplierTooltip: The speed of the Genomorpher process is multiplied by this number. Numbers below 1 decrease the time, while numbers above it increase it.
LanguageData.GR_WombMultiplierTooltip: The speed of the electrowomb process is multiplied by this number. Numbers below 1 decrease the time, while numbers above it increase it.
LanguageData.GR_FailureRateTooltip: By default, a genomorpher process will fail 10% of the time. This can be affected by boosters and other factors. This setting modifies that 10% base failure rate.
LanguageData.GR_QuestRateTooltip: The frequency of the abandoned lab quest being offered is multiplied by this number (with a multiplier of 1, it is offered every between 10 and 30 days at random). Numbers below 1 decrease the time, while numbers above it increase it. Note that this event doesn't "replace" normal quests, it works independently.
LanguageData.GR_RaidsRateTooltip: The frequency of the roaming, manhunting hybrids attacking your colony event is multiplied by this number (with a multiplier of 1, it is offered every between 10 and 30 days at random). Numbers below 1 decrease the time, while numbers above it increase it. Note that this event doesn't "replace" normal raids, it works independently.
LanguageData.GR_DisableOldAgeDiseasesTooltip: Disables all genetic diseases that afflict the hybrids after a given time, depending on their quality. Bear in mind that this effectively means the hybrids won't ever die of old age, as they don't receive "old age" diseases such as dementia.
LanguageData.GR_DisableHybridRaidsTooltip: Disables the roaming, manhunting hybrids attacking your colony periodically
LanguageData.GR_MakeAllHybridsControllableTooltip: Makes all hybrids draftable, being able to be ordered around by the player, without the need to use a controller booster
LanguageData.GR_MakeAllHybridsFertileTooltip: Makes all hybrids popping up from an electrowomb be fertile, and thus able to breed, without needing a fertility unlocker booster. Bear in mind this will still not work on insectoid hybrids, as eusocial insects aren't ever fertile.
